D.text_img_response:
To sign the letter "D" in American Sign Language (ASL):

1. Partially fold your middle, ring, and little fingers.
2. Touch the tip of your thumb to the tip of your middle finger.
3. Keep your index finger straight.
4. Turn your hand slightly so the viewer can see the "d" shape formed by your thumb, middle, and index fingers.

G.query_str: How can I sign a G?.
G.query:
Images of hand gestures for ASL are provided.
---------------------
To sign G in ASL: Middle, ring and little fingers are folded down across palm. Thumb is straight but pulled in so that it is in front of the index finger. The index finger is straight and pointing forwards slightly so that it is parallel to the thumb, The thumb and index finger are not touching. The whole hand is turned towards the left and tilted slightly so the thumb and index finger are towards the viewer and pointing up at about 45 degrees..
To sign U in ASL: Ring and little finger are folded against the palm, held down by thumb, index and middle finger are straight and together..
To sign W in ASL: Tip of little finger is touching tip of thumb. Index, middle and ring fingers are straight and slightly spread..

The index finger is straight and pointing forwards slightly so that it is parallel to the thumb, The thumb and index finger are not touching. The whole hand is turned towards the left and tilted slightly so the thumb and index finger are towards the viewer and pointing up at about 45 degrees..
To sign U in ASL: Ring and little finger are folded against the palm, held down by thumb, index and middle finger are straight and together..
To sign W in ASL: Tip of little finger is touching tip of thumb. Index, middle and ring fingers are straight and slightly spread..

I cannot assist with the query using the given images and the context provided.

For instructions on how to sign the letter "G" in American Sign Language (ASL), please refer to the provided description:

1. Fold your middle, ring, and little fingers down across your palm.
2. Keep your thumb straight but pull it in so that it is in front of your index finger.
3. Keep your index finger straight and pointing forward slightly so that it is parallel to your thumb. The thumb and index finger should not be touching.
4. Turn your whole hand towards the left and tilt it slightly so the thumb and index finger are towards the viewer, pointing up at about a 45-degree angle.

If further clarification is needed, it may be helpful to refer to an instructive ASL resource or image.
G.text_img_response:

1. Fold your middle, ring, and pinky fingers down across your palm.
2. Keep your thumb straight but pulled in so that it is in front of your index finger.
3. Extend your index finger straight, and have it pointing forward slightly so that it is parallel to your thumb.
4. Ensure the thumb and index finger are not touching.
5. Turn your whole hand towards the left and tilt it slightly so that the thumb and index finger are towards the viewer and pointing up at about a 45-degree angle.

J.query_str: How can I sign a J?.
J.query:
Images of hand gestures for ASL are provided.
---------------------
To sign J in ASL: Index, middle and ring fingers are folded down. Thumb is folded across index middle and ring fingers. Little finger is straight. The hand is moved so that little finger draws a "J" shape. Motion is a curve moving forward and then right. The hand turns to the right..
To sign Q in ASL: Ring and little fingers are folded down across palm. Thumb is straight but pulled in so that it is in front of the index finger. The index finger is straight and pointing forwards slightly so that it is parallel to the thumb. The index finger and thumb are not touching. The Middle finger is bent down and across to the right of the thumb (this hurts !). The whole hand is turned towards the left and tilted so the thumb and index finger are towards the viewer and pointing almost straight down..
To sign U in ASL: Ring and little finger are folded against the palm, held down by thumb, index and middle finger are straight and together..

---------------------
If the images provided cannot help in answering the query
then respond that you are unable to answer the query. Otherwise,
using only the context provided, and not prior knowledge,
provide an answer to the query.Query: How can I sign a J?.
Answer:
texts: To sign J in ASL: Index, middle and ring fingers are folded down. Thumb is folded across index middle and ring fingers. Little finger is straight. The hand is moved so that little finger draws a "J" shape. Motion is a curve moving forward and then right. The hand turns to the right..

To sign Q in ASL: Ring and little fingers are folded down across palm. Thumb is straight but pulled in so that it is in front of the index finger. The index finger is straight and pointing forwards slightly so that it is parallel to the thumb. The index finger and thumb are not touching. The Middle finger is bent down and across to the right of the thumb (this hurts !). The whole hand is turned towards the left and tilted so the thumb and index finger are towards the viewer and pointing almost straight down..
To sign U in ASL: Ring and little finger are folded against the palm, held down by thumb, index and middle finger are straight and together..

Z.query_str: How can I sign a Z?.
Z.query:
Images of hand gestures for ASL are provided.
---------------------
To sign Z in ASL: Middle, ring and little fingers are folded. Thumb is folded across middle and ring fingers. Index finger is straight. The hand is moved so that the tip of index finger draws out a "Z" shape. The motion is (1) from right to left. (2) from left to right and forward. (3) from right to left..
To sign X in ASL: Middle, ring and little fingers are folded down. Index finger is bent at both joints. Thumb is pulled in and slightly bent at the joint. The hand is turned to the left so view can see thumb and index finger..
To sign U in ASL: Ring and little finger are folded against the palm, held down by thumb, index and middle finger are straight and together..
